00022 using System;

00025 namespace MathNet.Numerics.Transformations

00033     public class ComplexFourierTransformation
00034     {
00035         InternalFFT _fft;
00036         TransformationConvention _convention;
00037 
00041         public
00042         ComplexFourierTransformation()
00043         {
00044             _fft = new InternalFFT();
00045             _convention = TransformationConvention.Default;
00046         }
00047 
00052         public
00053         ComplexFourierTransformation(
00054             TransformationConvention convention
00055             )
00056         {
00057             _fft = new InternalFFT();
00058             _convention = convention;
00059         }
00060 
00064         public TransformationConvention Convention
00065         {
00066             get { return _convention; }
00067             set { _convention = value; }
00068         }

00070         #region Scales

00074 
00075 
00076         public
00077         double[]
00078         GenerateTimeScale(
00079             double sampleRate,
00080             int numberOfSamplePairs
00081             )
00082         {
00083             double[] scale = new double[numberOfSamplePairs];
00084             double t = 0, step = 1.0 / sampleRate;
00085             for(int i = 0; i < numberOfSamplePairs; i++)
00086             {
00087                 scale[i] = t;
00088                 t += step;
00089             }
00090 
00091             return scale;
00092         }
00093 
00099         public
00100         double[]
00101         GenerateFrequencyScale(
00102             double sampleRate,
00103             int numberOfSamplePairs
00104             )
00105         {
00106             double[] scale = new double[numberOfSamplePairs];
00107             double f = 0, step = sampleRate / numberOfSamplePairs;
00108             int secondHalf = (numberOfSamplePairs >> 1) + 1;
00109             for(int i = 0; i < secondHalf; i++)
00110             {
00111                 scale[i] = f;
00112                 f += step;
00113             }
00114 
00115             f = -step * (secondHalf - 2);
00116             for(int i = secondHalf; i < numberOfSamplePairs; i++)
00117             {
00118                 scale[i] = f;
00119                 f += step;
00120             }
00121 
00122             return scale;
00123         }
00124         #endregion
00125 
00126         #region Dimensions: 1
00127 
00128 
00129 
00130 
00131         public
00132         void
00133         TransformForward(
00134             double[] samplePairs
00135             )
00136         {
00137             if(Fn.CeilingToPowerOf2(samplePairs.Length) != samplePairs.Length)
00138             {
00139                 throw new ArgumentException(Resources.ArgumentPowerOfTwo, "samplePairs");
00140             }
00141 
00142             _fft.DiscreteFourierTransform(samplePairs, true, _convention);
00143         }
00144 
00154         public
00155         void
00156         TransformForward(
00157             Complex[] samples
00158             )
00159         {
00160             if(Fn.CeilingToPowerOf2(samples.Length) != samples.Length)
00161             {
00162                 throw new ArgumentException(Resources.ArgumentPowerOfTwo, "samples");
00163             }
00164 
00165             double[] samplePairs = new double[samples.Length << 1];
00166             for(int i = 0, j = 0; i < samples.Length; i++, j += 2)
00167             {
00168                 samplePairs[j] = samples[i].Real;
00169                 samplePairs[j + 1] = samples[i].Imag;
00170             }
00171 
00172             _fft.DiscreteFourierTransform(samplePairs, true, _convention);
00173 
00174             for(int i = 0, j = 0; i < samples.Length; i++, j += 2)
00175             {
00176                 samples[i].Real = samplePairs[j];
00177                 samples[i].Imag = samplePairs[j + 1];
00178             }
00179         }
00180 
00185         public
00186         void
00187         TransformBackward(
00188             double[] samplePairs
00189             )
00190         {
00191             if(Fn.CeilingToPowerOf2(samplePairs.Length) != samplePairs.Length)
00192             {
00193                 throw new ArgumentException(Resources.ArgumentPowerOfTwo, "samplePairs");
00194             }
00195 
00196             _fft.DiscreteFourierTransform(samplePairs, false, _convention);
00197         }
00198 
00208         public
00209         void
00210         TransformBackward(
00211             Complex[] samples
00212             )
00213         {
00214             if(Fn.CeilingToPowerOf2(samples.Length) != samples.Length)
00215             {
00216                 throw new ArgumentException(Resources.ArgumentPowerOfTwo, "samplePairs");
00217             }
00218 
00219             double[] samplePairs = new double[samples.Length << 1];
00220             for(int i = 0, j = 0; i < samples.Length; i++, j += 2)
00221             {
00222                 samplePairs[j] = samples[i].Real;
00223                 samplePairs[j + 1] = samples[i].Imag;
00224             }
00225 
00226             _fft.DiscreteFourierTransform(samplePairs, false, _convention);
00227             for(int i = 0, j = 0; i < samples.Length; i++, j += 2)
00228             {
00229                 samples[i].Real = samplePairs[j];
00230                 samples[i].Imag = samplePairs[j + 1];
00231             }
00232         }

00242 
00243         public
00244         void
00245         TransformForward(
00246             double[] samplePairs,
00247             params int[] dimensionLengths
00248             )
00249         {
00250             for(int i = 0; i < dimensionLengths.Length; i++)
00251             {
00252                 if(Fn.CeilingToPowerOf2(dimensionLengths[i]) != dimensionLengths[i])
00253                 {
00254                     throw new ArgumentException(Resources.ArgumentPowerOfTwoEveryDimension, "dimensionLengths");
00255                 }
00256             }
00257 
00258             _fft.DiscreteFourierTransformMultiDim(samplePairs, dimensionLengths, true, _convention);
00259         }
00260

00274         void
00275         TransformForward(
00276             Complex[] samples,
00277             params int[] dimensionLengths
00278             )
00279         {
00280             for(int i = 0; i < dimensionLengths.Length; i++)
00281             {
00282                 if(Fn.CeilingToPowerOf2(dimensionLengths[i]) != dimensionLengths[i])
00283                 {
00284                     throw new ArgumentException(Resources.ArgumentPowerOfTwoEveryDimension, "dimensionLengths");
00285                 }
00286             }
00287 
00288             double[] samplePairs = new double[samples.Length << 1];
00289             for(int i = 0, j = 0; i < samples.Length; i++, j += 2)
00290             {
00291                 samplePairs[j] = samples[i].Real;
00292                 samplePairs[j + 1] = samples[i].Imag;
00293             }
00294 
00295             _fft.DiscreteFourierTransformMultiDim(samplePairs, dimensionLengths, true, _convention);
00296 
00297             for(int i = 0, j = 0; i < samples.Length; i++, j += 2)
00298             {
00299                 samples[i].Real = samplePairs[j];
00300                 samples[i].Imag = samplePairs[j + 1];
00301             }

00345             params int[] dimensionLengths
00346             )

00348             for(int i = 0; i < dimensionLengths.Length; i++)
00349             {
00350                 if(Fn.CeilingToPowerOf2(dimensionLengths[i]) != dimensionLengths[i])
00351                 {
00352                     throw new ArgumentException(Resources.ArgumentPowerOfTwoEveryDimension, "dimensionLengths");
00353                 }
00354             }
00355

00357             for(int i = 0, j = 0; i < samples.Length; i++, j += 2)
00358             {
00359                 samplePairs[j] = samples[i].Real;
00360                 samplePairs[j + 1] = samples[i].Imag;
00361             }
00362

00364 
00365             for(int i = 0, j = 0; i < samples.Length; i++, j += 2)
00366             {
00367                 samples[i].Real = samplePairs[j];
00368                 samples[i].Imag = samplePairs[j + 1];
